description: Provides a complete development environment for Java that can be deployed in one click. It includes most popular components for building Launchpad applications
name: Cloud Code
readme:
Launchpad Cloud Code
=============

This container provides access to Launchpad magic internal features, such as defining your own API, real-time datastore, deploying your Java code, and much more!

0. Launch your project in a few clicks.
0. Define your API by dropping a `api.json` file inside your container.
0. Define API paths inside `api.json` that behaves like a RESTful datastore with real-time capabilities.
0. Deploy Java code with access to Launchpad internal features, such as real-time handlers.

Usage
-----

Command line instructions coming soon.
readmeAsHtml:
Launchpad Cloud Code

This container provides access to Launchpad magic internal features, such as defining your own API, real-time datastore, deploying your Java code, and much more!

  1. Launch your project in a few clicks.
  2. Define your API by dropping a api.json file inside your container.
  3. Define API paths inside api.json that behaves like a RESTful datastore with real-time capabilities.
  4. Deploy Java code with access to Launchpad internal features, such as real-time handlers.

Usage

Command line instructions coming soon.

description: Send emails in one click by using this powerful email microservice via RESTful apis
name: Email
readme:
Launchpad Email
=============

This container provides a powerful email microservice for Launchpad. It's able to queue and send emails asynchronously, via RESTful APIs.

0. Launch your project in a few clicks.
0. Queue and send emails asynchronously.
0. Simple RESTful API.

Usage
-----

The first thing you have to do is install the container on a base path of your preference, e.g. `/email`. After the container is installed, you can use the exposed RESTful APIs to send emails.


### Sending Emails

`POST /email/emails`

```js
Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/email/emails')
	.form('from', 'from@domain.com')
	.form('to', 'to@domain.com')
	.form('message', 'Hi there!')
	.form('subject', 'Subject')
	.post()
	.then(function(response) {
		// The email was successfully sent.
		console.log('Email id:', response.body());
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});
```

#### Options


Option 		 | Type    | Description
------------ | ------- | ------------
bcc			 | string  | Bcc recipient email address. Multiple addresses should be defined in multiple parameters.
cc			 | string  | Cc recipient email address. Multiple addresses should be defined in multiple parameters.
from		 | string  | Sender email address.
message		 | string  | HTML content of your email message. Up to 5MB.
priority	 | number  | Used by email clients to define a message's importance. From 1 to 5 where '1' is highest and '5' is the lowest priority.
replyTo		 | string  | Append a reply-to address to your email message.
subject		 | string  | Subject of your email. Up to 1MB.
to			 | string  | Recipient email address. Multiple addresses should be defined in multiple parameters.

### Checking Email Status

`GET /email/emails/:id/status`

Let's say the email sent on the previous example returns the id `123`. In order to check its status you can request:

```js
Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/email/emails/123/status')
	.get()
	.then(function(response) {
		console.log('Email status:', response.body());
	});
```
readmeAsHtml:
Launchpad Email

This container provides a powerful email microservice for Launchpad. It’s able to queue and send emails asynchronously, via RESTful APIs.

  1. Launch your project in a few clicks.
  2. Queue and send emails asynchronously.
  3. Simple RESTful API.

Usage

The first thing you have to do is install the container on a base path of your preference, e.g. /email. After the container is installed, you can use the exposed RESTful APIs to send emails.

Sending Emails

POST /email/emails

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/email/emails')
	.form('from', 'from@domain.com')
	.form('to', 'to@domain.com')
	.form('message', 'Hi there!')
	.form('subject', 'Subject')
	.post()
	.then(function(response) {
		// The email was successfully sent.
		console.log('Email id:', response.body());
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});

Options

Option Type Description
bcc string Bcc recipient email address. Multiple addresses should be defined in multiple parameters.
cc string Cc recipient email address. Multiple addresses should be defined in multiple parameters.
from string Sender email address.
message string HTML content of your email message. Up to 5MB.
priority number Used by email clients to define a message’s importance. From 1 to 5 where ‘1’ is highest and ‘5’ is the lowest priority.
replyTo string Append a reply-to address to your email message.
subject string Subject of your email. Up to 1MB.
to string Recipient email address. Multiple addresses should be defined in multiple parameters.

Checking Email Status

GET /email/emails/:id/status

Let’s say the email sent on the previous example returns the id 123. In order to check its status you can request:

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/email/emails/123/status')
	.get()
	.then(function(response) {
		console.log('Email status:', response.body());
	});

description: Node.js is a platform built on Chrome's JavaScript runtime for easily building fast, scalable network applications. It uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient
name: Node.js
readme:
Node.js
=============

Node.js is a platform built on Chrome's JavaScript runtime for easily building fast, scalable network applications. It uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient.
readmeAsHtml:
Node.js

Node.js is a platform built on Chrome’s JavaScript runtime for easily building fast, scalable network applications. It uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient.

description: Liferay is a portal, web content management and collaboration software package. It includes social collaboration features such as a doc library, off-line document sync, internal messaging, online presence, and more
name: Liferay Portal
readme:
Liferay Portal 7.0.0
=============

This container provides a Liferay Portal that can be installed inside Launchpad infrastructure. Liferay is a portal, web content management and collaboration software package. It includes social collaboration features such as a doc library, off-line document sync, internal messaging, online presence, and more.

Coming soon.
readmeAsHtml:
Liferay Portal 7.0.0

This container provides a Liferay Portal that can be installed inside Launchpad infrastructure. Liferay is a portal, web content management and collaboration software package. It includes social collaboration features such as a doc library, off-line document sync, internal messaging, online presence, and more.

Coming soon.

description: Sign up, sign in and logout your users via RESTful APIs by this users management microservice
name: Users
readmeAsHtml:
Launchpad Users

This container provides a powerful users microservice for Launchpad. It’s able to sign up, login, logout, and manage users, via RESTful APIs.

  1. Launch your project in a few clicks.
  2. Signup, login, and logout APIs.
  3. Send reset password link and reset password APIs.
  4. Configure your login and logout redirect URLs.
  5. Securely store the user’s password.
  6. Simple RESTful API.

Usage

The first thing you have to do is install the container on a base path of your preference, e.g. /users. After the container is installed, the users container exposes RESTful APIs for you to use.

Create a User

POST /users/data

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/data')
	.form('email', 'user@domain.com')
	.form('password', 'password')
	.form('foo', 'bar')
	.post()
	.then(function(response) {
		// User stored!
		console.log('User id', response.body().id);
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error happened
	});

Options

Option Type Description
email string (required) The username used for user credentials.
password string (required) The password used for user credentials.
permissions array. Array of strings with user permissions.
roles array. Array of strings with user roles.

Get All Users

GET /users/data

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/data')
	.get()
	.then(function(response) {
		console.log('All users', response.body());
	});

Get a User

GET /users/data/:id

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/data/123')
	.get()
	.then(function(response) {
		console.log('User', response.body());
	});

Delete a User

DELETE /users/data/:id

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/data/123')
	.delete()
	.then(function(response) {
		// The user was successfully deleted.
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});

Send Reset Password Link to a User

POST /users/reset-password-link

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/reset-password-link')
    .form('email', 'user@domain.com')
	.post()
	.then(function(response) {
		// The reset password link was successfully sent.
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});

Options

Option Type Description
email string (required) The username used for user credentials.

Reset a User’s Password

POST /users/reset-password

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/reset-password-link')
    .form('email', 'user@domain.com')
    .form('password', 'newPassword')
    .form('token', 'token')
	.post()
	.then(function(response) {
		// The password was successfully reset.
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});

Options

Option Type Description
email string (required) The username used for user credentials.
password string (required) The new password used for user credentials.
token string (required) The reset password token received on the email.

Add Permissions for a User

PATCH /users/data/:id/permissions

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/data/123/permissions')
	.patch("newPermission")
	.then(function(response) {
		// The permission was successfully added.
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});

Update Permissions for a User

PUT /users/data/:id/permissions

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/data/123/permissions')
	.put(["permission1", "permission2"])
	.then(function(response) {
		// The permission was successfully updated.
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});

Add Roles for a User

PATCH /users/data/:id/roles

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/data/123/roles')
	.patch("newRole")
	.then(function(response) {
		// The role was successfully added.
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});

Update Roles for a User

PUT /users/data/:id/roles

Launchpad.url('http://[PROJECT].liferay.io/users/data/123/roles')
	.put(["role1", "role2"])
	.then(function(response) {
		// The role was successfully updated.
	})
	.catch(function(reason) {
		// Some error has happened
	});

description: Easily deploy and host your app's static assets (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc) with our production-grade hosting service
name: Static Hosting
readme:
Launchpad Static Hosting
=============

Easily deploy and host your app's static assets (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc) with our production-grade hosting service.
readmeAsHtml:
Launchpad Static Hosting

Easily deploy and host your app’s static assets (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc) with our production-grade hosting service.
